market_overview: Markets showed resilience this week despite mixed economic signals. NIFTY traded in a tight range, consolidating above key support levels. Banking sector led the rally with strong Q3 expectations, while IT remained under pressure due to global tech concerns.
key_insights: Banking sector outperformed with BANKNIFTY gaining 2.3% on strong credit growth data
Metal stocks witnessed profit booking after a 5-week rally
Pharma sector showed revival signs with multiple stocks breaking out of consolidation
FII activity turned positive after 3 weeks of selling, net buyers of â‚¹2,500 Cr
VIX remains subdued suggesting low volatility environment ahead

top_picks.rationale: Strong technical breakout above 1680 with volume confirmation. Target 1780.
Positive USFDA developments and sector rotation favoring pharma.
Breaking below key support of 420, weak IT sector sentiment.

sector_analysis: Bullish: Banking, Pharma, Auto | Neutral: FMCG, Energy | Bearish: IT, Metal. Rotation continues from IT to domestic consumption themes. PSU Banks showing relative strength.
outlook: Expect range-bound action in NIFTY (21800-22400) ahead of Q3 earnings season. Stock-specific moves will dominate. Key events: US Fed minutes, Indian CPI data. Maintain balanced portfolio with focus on quality large-caps.
